title: How long does it take to write a good non-fiction book (Malcolm Gladwell style), from initial idea to publishing? - Quora

response.answer_text: It takes about 10-20 years of experience (or 10,000 hours of work) to become that talented, and then it takes anywhere from 2 months to a few years to write the book, depending on how much research and preparation was done beforehand.
In part, it depends on the amount of research needed for the project. It took Susan Cain 7 years to write "Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking."
